reviews.text: I think the temple is relatively decent. I went around 5pm and there were no lights. The place seemed dark. There were a few spotlights inside. Some photos on this review show a backyard where prayers happen, but no one guided me there. The tourist fee of 10 RM is expensive. Night time might be best to come.
Excellent and purely God & positive vibration once enter. Guru's pooja and bhajans are breathtakingly beautiful 💓 Ambal is there 🌼🌹
Very Beautiful place. Well maintained. Peaceful area.

This temple is located at a hidden area. Easy to access. Plenty of parking space. The temple is the first GLASS temple in Asia. Once you enter into the temple, it is a WOW moment ! Stunning. The Kaliamma look gorgeous. A divine and a place full of blessing. To take photo video there are a small fee. Worth going.
Fantastic workmanship. Difficult to access. Took a Grab from town to reach the temple. Entrance fee of RM10 per person is charged.
Great artworks display in thr gallery. ♥️
Newly opened Dias Heritage Boutique @ Rumah Limas
The first of its kind in Malaysia, the Mawar Gallery showcases the "Gracious and Famous Ladies of Johor".
Good seafood at affordable price. Very friendly staffs at every lot. The one lot I've been needs to do booking. The lot in the middle of the food court. Sadly, can't remember the name.

I have made the visit to the Asam Pedas Power a must do event when visiting Johor Bahru.  

Nestled behind the main road, Tepian Tebrau has been a food haven for many years.  The Asam Pedas Power has a typical menu of seafood servings with a difference.

Many adjacent restaurant carries similar menu, but repeat clientele will wait for a free table when APW is fully occupied.

The usual order or large prawns- 4 pcs, asam pedas stingray, beansprout and squid for 2 pax will set you off around RM 80. It is worth every Ringgit spent.
The place my family will never miss when we are in Johore Bahru. Good food here. Cheap as well. Visit Faridah stall. The asam pedas is awesome.
Food goods and cheap. Most of them served seafood
so many variety of seafood, people busking ok but disturb people eating with their voice

The location was secluded, advisable to go early in the evening (7-8pm). Waiting for signature dish: Sup Tulang wasn't lengthy, despite the outrageous numbers of customers. Ride over here via E-Hailing, overall am satisfied. Good job to the owner.

This restaurant is hidden well, yet close to the city centre. Situated within a village-like atmosphere, it promises you quiet and calm surrounding, cool and cozy air. Most of the time, staff are very efficient in providing seat, taking orders, response to call and clean up table. But at times (especially peak hour), things can get a little out of control.

1 thing to improve, to provide enough fan (standing or ceiling) coz it can get a little warm plus mosquitoes under the table sometimes. Food mostly took not so long to wait, but again, depending on the number of guests, it could take a little longer.

Taste is great, yet nothing outstanding. If you are sup tulang lover, this place is for you.

Place was nice but to upgrade the cleanliness.. Food was not good as old reviews .. Ordered oblong but the patty was like not cooked long enough, the satay also pricey for a just tiny chicken satay and sup tulang was so so. Definitely wont come back to this place.

i like the environment here. we ordered sup tulang ala thai, kailan ikan masin, ayam goreng kunyit, telur dadar and sate. overall, the taste is just average and didn't meet my expectation.
i did not manage to take all the food's picture since i only remember to take picture after we ate almost half of the food.
Sup Tulang and Laksa Penang were so special. Unfortunately when we came at noon, no menu list. Hope the owner improve it. How could we know/choose  the menu if there is no menu book?
Nice food, nice cendol. price slightly high
Very nice food that is reasonably priced, a must try!
Best authentic nyonya food in JB so far bcos of its fresh ingredients.
Love the nyonya food~ nice taste
Cendol is a must have! rendang mutton was tender and not too hard. The ladies finger was a little too soft but the chilli was sedap...
Very good restaurant at reasonable prices. Rm 26 for paper wrapped chicken. Operating for the last 37 years
Famous for paper chicken. Baked with herbs spices. Very delicious

Food is really bad. I wouldnt even give it a star. Herbal Paper Chicken - the chicken taste so ‘dead’ for long. The meat are tough I thought I am having Turkey for Christmas. 

Ordered Spare Ribs - but the pork is like being in the shop for 10years it so tough that the spoon went broken (metal spoon) when I try to cut it.

We went over as no much food choices. But it is so terrible I suggest either you go other places or you just eat Teck Sing or Bak kut Teh. I am surprise they can actually survived next to Teck Sing.

Obviously quality is bad due to low turnover rate. Just save your stomach space & calories - avoid at own cost. 

#nonsponserpost
Good and affordable food. Highly recommend.
Good food and fast service

Good. Ordered the fish in curry soup and curry/tomyam based noodle.

A great place to have a quick meal and it is reasonably priced too. 

The fish curry soup taste is thick and flavourful
Average noodle place. Price is ok but portion ispretty small. Goodor a quick dinner Le bite but nothing fancy that will bring me back. The noodles' texture is kind of springy but not tasty.

I enjoyed my dinner here. Even when they are closing the staff takes time to explain the menu. I agree that the Tom yum bee Hoon is nothing to shout about but my mom loves the house special stating it’s like eating fishball crushed to be noodles. I was surprise to see oyster soup while it’s tasteless but the price is irresistible. The portion of the food here is huge so beware! Share if you tend to order a lot.
Food is very delicious especially the laksa with kwetiaw. Price is OK and all food are fresh.
Newly renovated with a fresh look but it's Yong Tauhu is still getting saltier...

Traditional style cafe offering western food. 

Ordered their fried chicken chop with 2 eggs, generous portion at a decent price. Taste is good, fried wedges were slightly soft to which I personally prefer.
Tried grilled and fried chicken chop. Fried chicken batter is good, grilled chicken is juicy. Potato could be crisper. Price is decent n staff is efficient
Food although good is not as good as memory serves me. The grilled chicken chop is tougher than ever. Gotta buck up

And yes - about a must for my visits to JB. Parking wasn't too difficult this time around. 

The food is good as always. Chicken chop. If you are not on diet, root beer float would be good too. I appreciate the food is prepared on demand, and not the frozen stuff and re-heated type. That's not easy to come by nowadays. 

Been back here a couple of times...and yes, I will return.
Never did I expect a sunny side-up egg would go so well with the deep fried chicken chop. Their fries rice was decent too though I guess MSG plays a significant role in it.
Nice & cozy place to chill out and entertain your companion
Cozy place, good choices of food, friendly staffs
Great place and environment to experience local Johorean food

Very very nice place to experience fine dining without having to be in a 3 to 4 star rated hotel!  The ambience is cosy and where you get services just like in a luxury hotel with piped music playing a standard Kenny G number. You can enjoy either air cond or non at your comfort. The ala carte menu is also very  satisfying and worth the price which is not that expensive as the hotels. A must try eatery and one of the best in JB for those who prefer fine dinings.
This place is  owesome I alway use this gym to make my body better

Decent food but a bit over hyped on the good rating. According to a local friend, it used to be good but not anymore. Price wise is on the higher tier but still affordable. Ordered onion soup and lamb loin. I liked the soup and the grilled vegetable as it was flavorful but the lamb was a bit let down as it was a bit too hard to chew, probably my fault for requesting well done.
Lovely place and authentic French restaurant with French owner. The best place to go in Johor if you want a authentic French flavor

I went to Chez Papa French to celebrate my boyfriend birthday, I got a shock that it require a smart casual attire (no slippers, no singlets, no shorts), but thankfully the owner was really nice to let us in still and provide us with crocs. They provide free bread before the meal which I thought was really nice. For appetisers we had French Onion Soup which I thought was really nice, big portion with a huge slab of cheese on top, herbs and caramelised onions. We also had scallops and prawns with a white wine cream sauce which was I find the the cream sauce was special because they added white wine, for this the portion is really small 2 scallops and 2 prawns, but it was just nice for us because only 2 of us. For mains (forgot to take picture) we had sirloin steak, medium rare as what we wanted and the pepper cream sauce is also nice. We also ordered a pesto linguine, which was really nice as well, though I find it a little too creamy, and the portion was huge so at the end it felt too jelak. I also like their service, because it was my boyfriend birthday they gave complimentary cake with ice cream and drew out the words Happy Birthday and even sang the birthday song. They really go the extra miles for their customers and deserve 5 star, because you know they don’t have to but they choose to. Overall really a pleasant place for special occasion and would definitely come back and try their other dishes.

Ambience: beautiful cosy place! Deco will transport you to a different place. Really nice Christmas deco. 
Food: French onion soup. Felt that it lacked body, didn’t feel wholesome. Had steak and seafood marinara for mains. Both were too salty. Felt that the mash potato was instant mash. Bread offered pre meal had a strange taste and texture not ideal (it’s edible! Just not to my liking)
Service: great. Staff are v warm, making the experience so nice. Chef took our comments (too salty) and offered to modify the dish with some extra ingredients which we appreciated. 
Cost/value for money: for the ambience and cuisine, it’s a place for special occasions. Not a place if looking for quality European food though. If do come back here, it’d be for ambience and wine

In my opinion one of the best French dining restaurant in JB. The quality of food has been consistent from the day it was opened till now. Wide selection of wines as well. They have daily specials on the chalk board on top of their menu. Look out for Shereen if you do not know what to eat. She will make you something that you would want more of...
